Anna Allshouse I received this email yesterday after asking questions for weeks. Good Evening —

Lauren here with Representative Anna Eskamani.

This message is a confirmation that our team received your submission to our Missing FPUC Payments Form to request assistance with $600 payments since May 19th. We have closed the form at 9:00pm and Representative Eskamani has since shared your submitted details to the Legislative Affairs Team at DEO which liaises between lawmakers and claim caseworkers.

Earlier this evening DEO shared that there are “two technology concerns that may have prevented an individual from receiving their Federal Pandemic Unemployment Compensation payment over the last few weeks.”

From DEO: “Individuals who requested that their claims be backdated were not included in recent payment files for the Federal Pandemic Unemployment Compensation payments. We are working diligently to ensure these claimants are made whole as quickly as possible. At this time claimants do not need to do anything but should continue to request benefits as long as they are unemployed or partially unemployed. The department anticipates having the issue resolved quickly and being able to provide these payments to eligible claimants. Additionally, the department has identified that some claimants were not paid their Federal Pandemic Unemployment Compensation payment for their waiting week. The department has identified these individuals and should have them paid their $600 federal payment within five business days.”

It’s incredibly disappointing to hear that DEO continues to make mistakes with claims and we’ll be asking DEO to expedite the list we have sent them.

Note: If you have other claim issues please consider filling out our Claim Escalation Form here which we will manually migrate into the DEO Escalation Portal to request a caseworker review your benefits ASAP. Finally we understand that this system has harmed Floridians far and wide. We are committed to systemic change and Rep. Eskamani voted yes to return to Tallahassee and fix unemployment ASAP — however this measure failed by a party line vote in May. She also joined a cohort of lawmakers in requesting more tools for lawmakers to help claimants however DEO has not since responded.

Please know that the issues with DEO are not your own fault and we are working hard and often to keep Floridians informed and hold the state accountable.

We also encourage you to keep in touch with us online where we share constant updates on current events and legislative advocacy with a recent emphasis on DEO coverage. You can find our team online on Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram at @AnnaForFlorida.

Stay safe and speak soon!

Lauren

Shelley RShelley
Federal Pandemic Unemployment Compensation (FPUC)
Under FPUC, eligible individuals will receive an additional $600 per week in addition to their weekly state Reemployment Assistance or other CARES Act program benefits.

This FPUC payment is 100% federally funded and is available for weeks of unemployment beginning March 29, 2020, and ends the week ending July 25, 2020.

FPUC is payable alongside the following programs:

Individuals who are collecting regular state Reemployment Assistance benefits
Individuals receiving Pandemic Emergency Unemployment Compensation (PEUC)
Individuals receiving Pandemic Unemployment Assistance (PUA)
Please keep in mind you cannot quit your job without good cause to obtain benefits under the state Reemployment Assistance program or the CARES Act. This constitutes fraud under the CARES Act, and an individual who obtains benefits through fraud is ineligible for any additional benefit payments, must pay back the benefits, and is subject to criminal prosecution under 18 U.S.C. § 1001.

Lulu App
-PSA. You wont see the link for PEUC until you request the funds for your last week. My last week was June 7-13 but my request date was June 22nd. I went in June 22nd and requested the funds for June 7-13 and it let me request funds for June 14-20 as well. No link for PEUC had shown up yet. The following date I go in and the link finally showed up. It asked me 19 yes or no questions and once I submitted it I went back to my home page and boom, I was already enrolled in PEUC. My balanced (benefit amount) went up for 13 weeks, my claim status is now "exhausted_active" and the program type is now "Pandemic EUC." Instead of getting paid for my two weeks at once how I normally did my funds for the week of June 7-13 showed up on my bank account on June 24 and the funds for the week of June 14-20 is currently pending to be deposited on my bank account. My fund request date has also been moved up a week so instead of going in in July to request my two weeks, I go back in on the 29th.

Also, if you pay for health insurance at work make sure the amount of unemployment they're giving you is based on how much you MADE, not how much you took home after paying for your health insurance. My mom pays for health insurance provided from her job and for some reason her unemployment amount was based on what she made after paying her health insurance which is incorrect. My sister also works for the mouse (disney) and pays insurance and she got the correct unemployment amount, based on how much money she made without deducting the amount that went for health insurance,, so keep an eye our for that. We're still waiting to hear from them to fix this issue so she can get the money she is owed.
